abstract: The soda brand withdrew from the Super Bowl for the first time in 23 years, giving the money away instead as it explored the potential of social media and cause-related marketing.
snippet: The soda brand withdrew from the Super Bowl for the first time in 23 years, giving the money away instead as it explored the potential of social media and cause-related marketing.
lead_paragraph: What’s better than reaching more than 100 million viewers during last year’s Super Bowl? For Pepsi, it could be 6,000 football fans during a high school game on Friday night in central Texas. Or a group of parents who wanted a new playground in their Las Vegas neighborhood.

headline.main: Pepsi Bets on Local Grants, Not the Super Bowl
